96020164-d-02-14-96-SOO.Narrative: BRAKES ON BN TRAIN 144 FAILED TO APPLY WHILE ON DESCENDING GRADE & BN DISPATCHER HAD TRAIN LINED INTO SOO LINE'S ST PAUL YARD. BN TRAIN 144 STRUCK VARIOUS CONSISTS STANDING ON TRACKS 1C; 2C; 41C & 42CAT AN ESTIMATED SPEED OF 49 MPH. BN RUNAWAY TRAIN CAME INTO SOO LINE'S ST PAUL YARD & DERAILED 7 ENGINES & 39 CARS, LOSING DIESEL FUEL ON DERAILED ENGINES, DESTROYED WEST HALF OF YARD OFFICE BUILDING& OVERHEAD PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE. BN TRAIN WAS COMING DOWN THE HILL AT MISSISSIPPI STREET ON THE BN. CREW REPORTED LOSING CONTROL & TRAIN BECAME A RUNAWAY TRAIN. BN TRAIN 144 REPORTED STRIKING SOO LINE'SFORD HAULER TRANSFER IN FRONT OF YARD OFFICE AT ST PAUL. BN CREW OFF OF TRAIN 144 & CREW OFF OF FORD HAULER, BOTH REPORTED JUMPING OFF THEIR RESPECTIVE TRAINS. CHIEF YARDMASTER ON DUTY CALLED INTO MILWAUKEE DISPATCHING CENTER & REQUESTED AMBULANCE, POLICE, FIRE DEPT & EVERYONE NECESSARY NOTIFIED. COMMUNICATION WAS LOST.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

615706-d-02-26-96-CMGN.Narrative: ON 2/26/96 CMGN TRAIN #771 WAS SHOVING EAST OUT OF THE DURAND YARD. TRAIN HAD TRAVELED APPROX. 500 FT. WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE BOTTOM (EAST END) PROTECTING THE MOVE ATTHE TIME THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE CONDUCTOR, WHILE WALKING THE TTAIN TO DETERMINE WHY TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY, FOUND CARS UTLX 96083 (METHYL CHLORIDE) AND DOWX 3468 (VINYLIDENE CHLORIDE)LAYING ON THEIR SIDES. CONDUCTOR NOTIFIED DISPATCHER WHO IN TURN NOTIFIED 911. IT WAS FOUND THAT THECARS WERE NOT LEAKING. INVE TIGATION OF THE CAUSE FOUND THAT THE LEAD WHEEL ON THE 1ST INVOLVED CARHAD DROPPED INSIDE THE RAIL CAUSING THE DERAILMENT. POOR TIE CONDITION CREATED A WIDE GAUGE CAUSINGWHEEL TO DROP OFF. ALSO CONTRIBUTING TO THE DERAILMENT WAS THE FACT THAT THE 1ST ONVOLVED CAR WAS IN A CURVE, AND DUE TO A RECENT THAW, THE GROUND AROUND THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS VERY WET AND SOFT. THIS SOFT CONDITION CONTRIBUTED TO THE CARS ROLLING OVER INSTEAD OF ACCORDIONING IN THE USUAL MANNER.NoneNoneNoneNone
